content.rendered:
Virtual Dreamin 20 is the “world’s First Salesforce Virtual Dreamin a fully virtual gathering of Ohana, and the first Salesforce Community event designed to be fully virtual. Geographical location is not an obstacle anymore, join Dreamin from anywhere on planet.”

Summary

Virtual Dreamin 20 was one of my favorite events, and a great distraction from lockdown . It was the first time I presented with one of my team members, Kenton San Miguel. Kenton’s passion for learning and Communities, as well as his energy and curiosity shine. Since both Kenton and I both love Communities, we created our presentation on our favorite topic. Once we were selected, we spent the month leading up to Virtual Dreamin 20, we worked together refining our session, learning, and practicing. The hard work we put in together lead to us ROCKING our session!

Session Overview

Our session, “Control the Storm: Become a Lightning Community Master” explained the powers of Lightning Communities. This session will be perfect for Community newbies and juggernauts that have been around the block. This session will make you want to jump in your Dev Org and try the items yourself! Some of the topics we will discuss include:

  • Capabilities and benefits of using Lightning Communities
  • Community Licensing (Seat vs. Login) including Unauthenticated
  • Lightning Community Templates
  • Bolt Solutions
  • Standard and custom Themes and Components
  • Lightning Community Page Types and dynamic options
  • Sharing and external data exposure
  • Differences between Sites and Lightning Communities

Presenters

Kenton San Miguel – Consultant

Kenton San Miguel is a Consultant at Xede Consulting Group. He is 6X Certified working toward becoming an Architect.

Meighan Brodkey – Tech Arch/Practice Manager

Meighan is a Salesforce MVP, Seattle Women in Tech User Group Leader, and admin/Founder of #OhanaSlack. She has over 400 Trailhead badges, and she is continuously working learning more about Salesforce. In addition, she has spoken around the world at Salesforce and community run events. Meighan’s favorite topic is Community Cloud. A few of her event sessions are Dreamforce x7, North Africa Dreamin ’19, YeurDreamin, Tahoe Dreamin, Surf Force, and the Chicago World Tour. Sharing her love of the platform with the Ohana is her passion. Over the past decade Meighan has gone from admin to architect. She gives thanks in part to the help and knowledge shared by other members of the community.

Resources

Session Recording

Session Deck

excerpt.rendered: Join Kenton san Miguel and Me when we present at Virtual Dreamin when we present on Community Cloud with our session, Control the Storm: Become a Lightning Community Master!
